title: Four dead and three injured in New York shooting
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Four people were killed and three others seriously wounded in a shooting in Brooklyn.

The NYPD say officers responding to an emergency call shortly before 7am Saturday morning found the deceased, all males aged between 32 and 49, along with a woman and two other men suffering non-life threatening injuries.

Police say the shooting took place inside an illegal gambling site in the Crown Heights neighbourhood, which has reportedly struggled with gang violence.

The building is two blocks from a police station.

Crime-scene tape surrounded the premises Saturday morning and investigators in white jumpsuits could be seen going in and out.

NYPD Chief of Detectives Dermot F. Shea said that two firearms have been recovered and more may be found.

No arrests have been made and there is no known motive at this stage, according to preliminary reports.

New York police officers secure the crime scene (Picture: AFP/Getty Images)

At least four people died and three were wounded (Picture: AFP/Getty Images)

Authorities responded to a call about shots fired just before 7am (Picture: AP)

The motive and exact circumstances are not known (Picture: AFP/Getty Images)

According to early information there have been no arrests (Picture: Getty Images)
